info.description: The Student Core service enables you to get core information about students.
info.title: studentCore

tags.name: holds
tags.description: This resource returns all Student Hold Assignments or a collection of Student Hold Assignments filtered by query parameters.

tags.name: immigrationEvents
tags.description:
Provides the ability to access immigration information and dependent information about international pre-matriculants. You can also use these REST APIs to submit immigration data for international pre-matriculants. 

To submit immigration data for an international pre-matriculant:

1. Get the immigration event ID for the student applicant by calling the GET /students/{ID}/immigrationEvents endpoint.

2. Get any existing information by calling the GET ​/immigrationEvents​/{ID}​/immigrationData​ and GET /immigrationEvents/{ID}/dependentImmigrationData endpoints.

3. Create immigration data by calling the POST /immigrationEvents/{ID}/immigrationData endpoint.

4. Create dependent immigration data by calling the POST ​/immigrationEvents​/{ID}​/dependentImmigrationData endpoint.

5. Optionally update related data by calling the PUT /immigrationEvents/{ID}/immigrationData and PUT /immigrationEvents/{ID}/dependentImmigrationData endpoints.

6. Submit the immigration data by calling the POST /immigrationEvents/{ID}/submit endpoint, which advances the Student Applicant Immigration Event business process to the next step. The data you submitted can be viewed on the International tab of the Student and Student Prospect profiles. 

For matriculated students, submit the Student Immigration Event in the Workday UI instead.

tags.name: students
tags.description:
This resource returns all matriculated students or a collection of matriculated students filtered by query parameters.
Scope: Student Core

tags.name: Prompt Values
tags.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of residence information for the specified student ID.
get.description: Retrieves a collection of residence information for the specified student ID. You can filter residence information by their institutionalAcademicUnit. Secured by: Manage: Student Residency, Self-Service: Student External Site User Access Scope: Academic Foundation, Student Core

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: institutionalAcademicUnit
parameters.description: The Institutions.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A2319 | This hold has already been removed. Specify an active hold.
A2322 | You can't override a hold with a Workday-delivered hold reason.
A2323 | You can't override a hold on yourself.
A2346 | Specify an End Date that occurs after the Start Date.
A2347 | Specify Hold Types that are valid for override.
A2348 | Specify a Start Date on or after today's date.
A2349 | You can't override a Hold with Hold Types that aren't applicable for this hold assignment.
A2350 | You can't override a hold assignment that already has an active override.

post.summary: Creates an Apply Student Hold Event.
post.description: Creates a single Apply Student Hold Event instance with the specified data. In the request body, specify these required fields: reason, typeContext. Secured by: Apply Student Hold (REST Service) Scope: Action Items and Holds

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1897 | You can't apply a hold on yourself.
A1898 | You can't apply a hold with a Workday-delivered hold reason.
A1899 | You can't select the same Hold Type more than once.
A1900 | Specify a hold reason for the student's institution.
A1901 | You can't apply a duplicate hold.
A1916 | Your tenant configuration prevents you from using the Applies to All hold context. Specify a student hold context.
A1917 | The student is associated with multiple institutions. To submit this hold type, specify a hold type context.
A1918 | Specify a Federal School Code that’s associated with the Academic Unit and Academic Level of the student.
A1919 | Specify a hold type context that corresponds to the institution of the Student Hold Reason.
A1921 | Specify a valid context for the selected hold type.
A1922 | Specify a valid financial aid award year context for the selected hold type.
A1923 | Specify a valid academic period context for the selected hold type.
A1926 | Specify the same Institution for each Hold Type.
A1927 | Specify the same Academic Record for each Hold Type.
A1928 | Specify the same Academic Period for each Hold Type.
A1929 | Specify the same Federal School Code Rule Set for each Hold Type.
A1930 | Specify the same Financial Aid Award Year for each Hold Type.
A1943 | You can only use an academic period that is on the academic calendar for the primary program of study on the academic record.
A1944 | The Award Year needs to be current, in the future, or 1 year prior.
A1945 | The Hold Type is not a valid Hold Type for this Hold Reason.
A1949 | Specify a valid Academic Record for the student.
A1950 | Specify an Academic Period that is current or in the future.
A1951 | Specify an Institution. The provided value isn't an institution.
A1971 | Specify an academic period that corresponds to the institution of the Student Hold Reason.
A2060 | Specify only one hold type context for each hold type, or leave it blank.
A2395 | Specify an award item that's in the student's financial aid package and configured with the Disbursement Hold Exists eligibility condition.
A2407 | Select an award item associated with the specified award year.

parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1899 | You can't select the same Hold Type more than once.
A1916 | Your tenant configuration prevents you from using the Applies to All hold context. Specify a student hold context.
A1917 | The student is associated with multiple institutions. To submit this hold type, specify a hold type context.
A1918 | Specify a Federal School Code that’s associated with the Academic Unit and Academic Level of the student.
A1919 | Specify a hold type context that corresponds to the institution of the Student Hold Reason.
A1921 | Specify a valid context for the selected hold type.
A1922 | Specify a valid financial aid award year context for the selected hold type.
A1923 | Specify a valid academic period context for the selected hold type.
A1926 | Specify the same Institution for each Hold Type.
A1927 | Specify the same Academic Record for each Hold Type.
A1928 | Specify the same Academic Period for each Hold Type.
A1929 | Specify the same Federal School Code Rule Set for each Hold Type.
A1930 | Specify the same Financial Aid Award Year for each Hold Type.
A1943 | You can only use an academic period that is on the academic calendar for the primary program of study on the academic record.
A1944 | The Award Year needs to be current, in the future, or 1 year prior.
A1949 | Specify a valid Academic Record for the student.
A1950 | Specify an Academic Period that is current or in the future.
A1951 | Specify an Institution. The provided value isn't an institution.
A1971 | Specify an academic period that corresponds to the institution of the Student Hold Reason.
A2060 | Specify only one hold type context for each hold type, or leave it blank.
A2395 | Specify an award item that's in the student's financial aid package and configured with the Disbursement Hold Exists eligibility condition.
A2407 | Select an award item associated with the specified award year.
A2769 | You can't update a hold for yourself.
A2770 | You can't update the Hold Type for this hold.
A2789 | You can’t update a hold on a prospective student.
A2793 | You can't update this hold because one or more events is in progress: [in progress events]. Complete or cancel all events before updating.
A2794 | You can't update a hold with a Workday-delivered hold reason.

parameters.description: The hold types to filter on.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

get.description: Retrieves all students. You can filter by academicLevel, academicUnit, programOfStudy etc. Secured by: Reports: Students, Self-Service: Student External Site User Access, Self-Service: Student Profile, Set Up: Student Sites, Student Data: Student Profile Scope: Academic Foundation, Student Core

parameters.name: academicUnit
parameters.description: Derived Academic Units.

parameters.name: activeOnly
parameters.description: Only return active students.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: programOfStudy
parameters.description: For students who haven't matriculated, the program of study they either applied to or have been admitted to. For matriculated students, the primary program of study from their reporting record.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A fuzzy search string that matches student IDs and names. Example: search=bri%20book returns the student Brian Booker.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.
